intro: Phyllodolon, commonly known as the African evergreen, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Phyllodolon is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
